rComments: Leiva is a nice guy. He really cares about what he's teaching. His lectures are clear and while they help on quizzes, not so much on the exams, but those can easily be passed by going to the website he mentions. Super easy and hardly ever showed up to lectures.

The tests are v. hard: "What percentage of Mexicans owned land before the revoluation?" The lectures are v. boring and not relevant to the exams 90% of the time. tests aren't on concepts, but on minutiae from books. Didn't even show up to the final, and of course there was a huge error. Section attendance mandatory. Too hard for intro class. Avoid!

Professor Leiva is an amazing lecturer. Haven't talk to him in Office Hours but he is more than approachable and welcoming! Midterm 1 was not difficult whatsoever but did require reading Chasteen and Gonzalez thoroughly. He is truly a passionate person and doesn't ask much of students besides wanting to learn more! Highly recommend him.
He seems like a cool dude, it is just that lecture is super long and it gets boring. The reading are interesting and the tests given are pretty straight forward. In order to do well you must read.

Gives detailed explanation for intro to LALS. Lectures are definitely boring, but feels more appealing to listen to if you have read the assigned chapters. For sure, the book is very helpful. Grading from Syllabus (subject to change) -2 Quizzes (15% each) in Section -1 Midterm (30%) -Final (30%) -Participation from Section (10%) Mandatory

He is genuinely passionate about opening the perspectives of students towards latin american notions. Proves the importance of the involvement by US in Latin American countries contributes to their poor status. He just wants everyone to open their eyes to how the world really works and would hope you consider an LALS major.

Professor Leiva is a new a faculty member at UCSC. He's great and very passionate about the subject. He provided study guides for the quizzes and midterms that were very helpful. I would definitely recommend.

Prof. Leiva is a new faculty to UCSC and this was his first time teaching LALS 1. Lectures are long of course because there is so much material he has to cover but if you make sure to read the chapter assigned before class, lecture will make SO MUCH more sense and time will fly by! He is great, I look forward to taking LALS 158 with him in spring!
